intro: Lubinia mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Lubinia mauritiana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Its medicinal properties have been studied for potential use in traditional herbal remedies.
